title: Audio-Based Pedestrian Detection in the Presence of Vehicular Noise
summary: This paper presents a new dataset and analysis for audio-based pedestrian detection in the presence of vehicular noise. It explores cross-dataset evaluation and the impact of noisy data on model performance, highlighting the influence of acoustic context.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions a "new dataset" and discusses the "presence of vehicular noise" and "acoustic context", which aligns with the concept of a "Contextual dataset". While not directly about spatio-temporal point processes, the focus on a specific type of contextual data makes it relevant.
